executiveSummary: Alandra and Ramy, professionally trained chefs from San Francisco, pitched their business 'Dogue' on Shark Tank, seeking $100,000 for 20% equity. Their company offers gourmet, protein-rich dog pastries, meals, and a fine dining experience for dogs. Despite strong branding and creativity, all Sharks declined to invest due to scalability and logistics challenges, particularly with refrigerated shipping.

actionItems.task: Develop a clear plan for scaling and shipping refrigerated dog food products nationwide
Refine packaging and logistics to preserve product integrity during shipping
Focus on direct-to-consumer sales and strengthen retail operations

nextSteps: Alandra and Ramy will continue growing Dogue independently, likely focusing on direct-to-consumer sales and refining their packaging and shipping strategies before pursuing further investment.
